title: Question 1
prompt:

description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: In the excerpt from the play, when Nora first asks Torvald to look at what she’s bought, Torvald says, “Bought, did you say? All these things? Has my little spendthrift been wasting money again?” He is pleasant, but he’s clearly displeased. He scolds her almost like a child, and his lecture about borrowing shows that he is serious about not spending money. “No debt, no borrowing,” expresses Torvald’s attitude toward money. He wants Nora to keep spending within their means. If Nora spent the money Torvald gave her right away, she would not be keeping her spending within their means. He would likely have a similar reaction, to scold Nora for spending the money.
